segments.Text: So I'm a civil rights group called EFFI.
There are two guys from Finland who founded this organization like two years ago.
My name is Mikko and he is Ville.
What we are trying to tell you is what we actually did there in Finland and how could we influence the Finnish lawmakers and
policy makers and in recent times also a European-wide activity. What has happened in
Brussels and what we are trying to do there to stop the innovation-shetting laws
and similar kind of proposals. What you also have here in the US are now like
spreading into Europe. A few words about our name. We are not related to EFF in any official
sense. We just fair use their trademark.
It's like electronic frontier Finland.
And when we found in this organization, I just browsed the domain name database,
and I found out that that's pretty interesting domain name.
It's almost EFF.
We can be like confused with EFF.
We are having like similar goals and similar values,
but of course we are an independent organization in a very little country far away from here.
from here. So maybe we just tried with their good name.
Here's some kind of background with official figures what has happened so far.
So we were founded in September 2001. It was something like two weeks before the attacks,
or even less it was one week and a bit more. That was such coincidence.
Now we have over 300 members. We are like members who put the organization. All members like
like pay membership fees annually and they do actively participate in what we do.
And the number has been growing like steadily. I think we have like 350, maybe 400 members now.
Most are from Finland, but we also have international members nowadays.
I could guess something like less than 10% are international members from different countries, even from the United States.
So the kind of brain, brain,
brain work what happens in EFFI is done by a small board.
We have like, let's say eight board members and then couple other guys who are very like
interesting and do volunteer work there.
In the beginning we were just like two or three guys, but now it's like 10 active
active guys who do do something to push this message forward.
And most of us are working at the universities in Finland and also in some companies there.
there.
This is, of course, volunteer work.
No money is involved.
Only the money we get in.
As donations we use to put some, like, like, public stuff up.

Finland with our money we have gathered for members and donations.
But so far, what we have done is basically that we have commented law proposals doing all kinds of paperwork,
trying to put media releases out if there's some new law proposal out there and what we think about it.
Maybe the two most important law proposals so far we have commented and really changed have been the copyright proposal,
similar kind that you have the DMCA here, and another one was about like free speech issues.

later.
